thread.title: Derby 4 Wolves 2 - as it happened

title: Derby 4 Wolves 2 - as it happened
text: This live stream has now ended. Updates appear in chronological order. 12:26 Their record at Pride Park/The iPro was almost flawless before then. Four wins and two draws from six matches. #wwfc — Tim Spiers (@tim_spiers_Star) October 18, 2015 12:28 Some great memories for Wolves fans here. Memorable goals from Kenny Miller, Tom Huddlestone, and of course this... pic.twitter.com/EpjBa81Kq5 — Tim Spiers (@tim_spiers_Star) October 18, 2015 12:40 . @OfficialWolves can leapfrog above @dcfcofficial into 7th with a win this afternoon. Join @tim_spiers_Star and @njudah_star for the action — Nathan Judah (@njudah_star) October 18, 2015 12:40 . @OfficialWolves can leapfrog above @dcfcofficial into 7th with a win this afternoon. Join @tim_spiers_Star and @njudah_star for the action — Nathan Judah (@njudah_star) October 18, 2015 12:55 Ikeme, Doherty, EEL, Batth, Ricketts, Saville, KMac, Evans, Sako, Henry, Clarke.Last years line-up for the defeat at Derby. Lots of change — Wolves Pictures (@WolvesPictures) October 18, 2015 12:57 — Tim Spiers (@tim_spiers_Star) October 18, 2015 13:00 — Tim Spiers (@tim_spiers_Star) October 18, 2015 13:10 A look at Derby's bench shows what a strong squad they have: Grant, Baird, Warnock, Shotton, Butterfield, Weimann, Bent. Big test for Wolves — Tim Spiers (@tim_spiers_Star) October 18, 2015 13:10 — Ethan Ebanks-Landell (@EbanksLandell) October 18, 2015 13:11 Players are in the tunnel. @OfficialWolves crowd expected to be 1,500. Here we go! Are you reaaadddyy? #wwfc — Nathan Judah (@njudah_star) October 18, 2015 Tap to see all updates in full screen. Close fullscreen
